revision.comment: Created page with "{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Edimax |model=AI-1001W |revision=V2 |fcc_date=08/02/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=sensor, IoT |fcc_id=NDD9510011802 |pwr_v=5 |..."
revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Edimax |model=AI-1001W |revision=V2 |fcc_date=08/02/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=sensor, IoT |fcc_id=NDD9510011802 |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=USB Female Micro-B |cpu1_brand=Realtek |cpu1_model=RTL8195AM |cpu1_cspeed=166 |ram1=2.5 |ram1_brand=Realtek |ram1_model=RTL8195AM |wi1_module_if=on-board SiP |wi1_chip1_brand=Realtek |wi1_chip1_model=RTL8195AM |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=1 |wi1_rxchains=1 |wi1_sstreams=1 |eth_none=true |flags=PM2.5 sensor, temperature sensor, humidity sensor, |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=PM2.5_Serup_XX |default_user=admin |default_pass=1234 }} {{TagLine|AirBox : Smart Air Quality Detector with PM2.5, Temperature and Humidity Sensors}} :{{ProductPage|https://www.edimax.com/edimax/merchandise/merchandise_detail/data/edimax/global/air_quality_monitoring_semioutdoor/ai-1001w_v2/}}
"BP 4M E186014" and "1244-00001409-50Z_ES" are silkscreened on the wireless module and "BP 4M E186014" and "1244-00001410-50Z_ES" are silkscreened on the main board in the FCC photos. The "BP" IDs suggest that these boards were made by [http://www.brain-power.net/ Brain Power]
The Realtek Ameba chip ID is not shown in the internal photos so the RTL8195AM is just a guess, for now.
Additional model names are covered by this FCC entry: AI-1001W, AI-1001W V3, AI-1001W V4, AI-1002W, AI-1003W
===News=== * [https://www.edimax.com/edimax/post/post/data/edimax/global/press_releases/2295/ ''Edimax Announces City-Wide AirBox Rollout Across Taipei with Free App Available to Monitor Air Quality.'' on '''Edimax'''] :"Featuring advanced Realtek Ameba chipsets"
